definitions: flat frame with handles used to carry injured or sick people
device or tool used to stretch materials like canvas or leather
examples: The paramedics carefully lifted the patient onto the stretcher
Two people carried the stretcher down the narrow stairs
The artist used a canvas stretcher to prepare the painting surface
He needed a shoe stretcher to widen his tight leather boots

definitions: act of extending muscles and limbs to improve flexibility and prevent injury
examples: Morning stretching helps prepare your body for the day ahead
The yoga class began with gentle stretching exercises

definitions: single long step taken when walking or running
significant progress or improvement in development or achievement
examples: He took long strides to keep up with the group
Her confident stride showed she meant business
The company made great strides in renewable energy research
Technology has taken huge strides forward in recent years

definitions: angry or violent disagreement between people or groups causing suffering and tension
examples: The region has experienced decades of political strife
Family strife can affect children's emotional development

definitions: event in baseball when batter fails to hit after three strikes
examples: The pitcher recorded his tenth strikeout of the game
His strikeout ended the team's chance to score

definitions: forward player in soccer whose main job is scoring goals
worker who stops working as form of protest for better conditions
examples: The striker scored two goals in the championship match
Their new striker cost the club twenty million dollars
The factory strikers picketed outside the main entrance
Company negotiations with strikers lasted for three weeks

definitions: quality of being very noticeable or impressive in appearance
act of refusing to work as organized protest
examples: Her striking resemblance to her mother surprised everyone
The building's striking architecture dominated the city skyline
The striking lasted for two weeks before reaching agreement
Workers began striking after failed contract negotiations

definitions: freelance reporter who contributes stories to news organizations part-time
horizontal structural member that provides support in construction
examples: The newspaper hired local stringers to cover rural areas
She worked as a stringer before becoming a staff reporter
The carpenter installed stringers to support the staircase
Bridge stringers carry the weight of the deck

definitions: long narrow band of color that contrasts with surrounding material
examples: The tiger's orange and black stripes provide natural camouflage
Her shirt had blue and white stripes running vertically

definitions: decorative pattern consisting of parallel bands of contrasting colors
process of painting lines on roads for traffic guidance
examples: The zebra's distinctive striping helps confuse predators
The car featured custom red striping along the sides
Road striping improves safety by clearly marking lanes
Fresh striping made the parking spaces easier to see

definitions: tool or chemical used to remove paint or other coatings
person who performs striptease as entertainment in clubs
examples: Use paint stripper to remove old layers before repainting
The chemical stripper worked quickly on the wooden furniture
The club hired professional strippers for entertainment
She worked as a stripper to pay for college

definitions: act of removing layers, coatings, or coverings from surfaces
examples: Stripping old paint revealed beautiful original woodwork underneath
The stripping process took several hours to complete

definitions: entertainment act where performer gradually removes clothing to music
examples: The cabaret featured professional striptease performances every night
She learned striptease dancing at a specialized school

definitions: continuous effort to achieve something difficult or reach a goal
examples: Her constant striving for perfection sometimes caused stress
Their striving for excellence produced remarkable results

definitions: bright light that flashes repeatedly at regular intervals for special effects
examples: The dance club's strobe lights created an energetic atmosphere
Emergency vehicles use strobe lights to increase visibility

definitions: act of moving hand gently over surface in repeated smooth movements
examples: Gentle stroking helps calm anxious pets
The mother's stroking soothed her crying baby

definitions: slow relaxed walk taken for pleasure without hurrying
examples: They took an evening stroll through the peaceful garden
A morning stroll along the beach refreshed her mind

definitions: fortress or heavily defended place difficult to capture
place where particular group or belief has strong support
examples: The ancient stronghold protected the kingdom for centuries
Enemy forces couldn't breach the mountain stronghold
The city remains a stronghold of conservative politics
This region is a stronghold for traditional crafts

definitions: performer who demonstrates feats of physical strength as entertainment
political leader who rules through force rather than democratic means
examples: The circus strongman lifted heavy weights to amaze crowds
He worked as a strongman at the carnival
The country's strongman ruled with an iron fist
Military strongmen often suppress democratic movements

definitions: sound made by sweeping fingers across guitar strings casually
examples: She could hear someone strum a guitar from the next room
His gentle strum accompanied the campfire songs

definitions: confident walking style that shows pride or arrogance
structural bar designed to resist compression in framework
examples: His arrogant strut annoyed everyone at the party
The peacock's strut displayed its beautiful feathers
The engineer reinforced the bridge with steel struts
Aircraft wings use struts for additional support

definitions: short piece left after larger part has been used or removed
examples: He kept the ticket stub as a souvenir
The pencil stub was too short to write with

definitions: short stiff hair growth on face between shaves
examples: His three-day stubble gave him a rugged appearance
The stubble on his chin felt rough against her cheek

definitions: decorative plaster coating applied to walls for textured finish
examples: The Mediterranean-style house featured white stucco walls
They applied stucco to cover the concrete blocks

definitions: small decorative metal piece attached to leather or fabric
male animal kept specifically for breeding purposes
vertical wooden beam in wall frame supporting structure
examples: Her leather jacket was decorated with silver studs
The belt featured brass studs along its length
The farm's prize stud sired many champion horses
They brought their mare to breed with the stud
The carpenter nailed drywall to the wall studs
Electrical wires run between the studs in walls

definitions: grant or scholarship that provides financial support for graduate study
examples: She received a full studentship to pursue her doctorate
The university offers several research studentships each year

definitions: act of reading and learning about subjects to gain knowledge
examples: Late-night studying before exams exhausted many students
Her studying paid off with excellent grades

definitions: soft material used to fill cushions, toys, or furniture
seasoned mixture placed inside poultry or vegetables before cooking
examples: The old sofa needed new stuffing in its cushions
Cotton stuffing made the teddy bear soft and huggable
Grandma's turkey stuffing recipe included sage and onions
The stuffing absorbed delicious flavors from the roast

definitions: part of tree trunk left in ground after cutting
place or occasion for making political speeches during campaigns
examples: The old oak stump served as a natural garden seat
They had to remove several stumps before building
The candidate delivered passionate speeches from the stump
His stump speech focused on economic reform

definitions: act of traveling to make political speeches during election campaigns
examples: The senator spent weeks stumping across rural districts
Her stumping efforts helped win crucial votes

definitions: person of remarkable beauty who attracts attention
event or news that causes great surprise or shock
examples: The actress was a real stunner in her red dress
He dated several stunners during his college years
The election result was a real stunner for pollsters
Her resignation came as a stunner to colleagues

definitions: dangerous action performed for entertainment or publicity
condition of restricted growth or development
examples: The motorcycle stunt thrilled the movie audience
Professional stunt performers train extensively for safety
Poor nutrition can stunt a child's physical development
The disease caused a stunt in the plant's growth

definitions: condition where growth is significantly slowed or stopped due to malnutrition or disease
examples: Childhood stunting affects millions in developing countries
Proper nutrition prevents stunting in young children

definitions: quality of being extremely foolish or showing very poor judgment
examples: His stupidity in ignoring safety rules caused the accident
The sheer stupidity of the plan became obvious later

definitions: state of near unconsciousness or insensibility often caused by drugs, alcohol, or shock
examples: The patient remained in a stupor after the surgery
Excessive drinking left him in a complete stupor

definitions: large prehistoric fish valued for its meat and eggs which become caviar
examples: The restaurant served fresh sturgeon with lemon sauce
Sturgeon populations declined due to overfishing for caviar

definitions: speech disorder causing involuntary repetition or prolonging of sounds
examples: His nervous stutter appeared during public speaking
Speech therapy helped her overcome her childhood stutter

definitions: process of designing appearance or arranging elements aesthetically
art of cutting and arranging hair in attractive ways
examples: The car's sleek styling appealed to younger buyers
Interior styling transformed the plain room completely
Professional styling made her hair look fantastic
The salon specializes in bridal hair styling

definitions: person who advises on clothing and creates fashionable looks
professional who cuts, colors, and arranges hair
examples: The celebrity's stylist selected outfits for red carpet events
Fashion stylists help create magazine photo shoots
Her hair stylist recommended a shorter cut for summer
The stylist worked magic with color and highlights

definitions: person who temporarily replaces another in a job or position
underwater naval vessel capable of independent operation
long sandwich made with various meats and toppings
examples: The teacher called for a sub when she got sick
Our regular goalkeeper was injured so the sub played
The navy's nuclear sub patrolled international waters
The sub surfaced after three weeks underwater
He ordered an Italian sub with extra cheese
The deli makes the best subs in town

definitions: small group formed from larger committee to focus on specific tasks or issues
examples: The budget subcommittee reviewed all department spending requests
She chairs the education subcommittee in the senate

definitions: smallest category of automobile designed for basic economical transportation
examples: The subcompact gets excellent gas mileage in city driving
Many students prefer affordable subcompact cars

definitions: large distinct landmass forming part of continent but considered separate geographically or politically
examples: The Indian subcontinent includes several neighboring countries
The subcontinent has diverse cultures and languages
